text:
Are there any structural identifiability tools in julia?
More specifically, given a dynamic model `du/dt = f(u,theta,x,t)`,with u the dynamic states; theta the unknown parameters; x some control parameters, and a (possibly noisy) measurement model `y(t_i) = h(u,theta,x,t_i)` is is possible to estimate the true theta from the observations y, or will different values of theta give rise to exactly the same dynamics.

elements.text:
Are there any structural identifiability tools in julia?
More specifically, given a dynamic model
,with u the dynamic states; theta the unknown parameters; x some control parameters, and a (possibly noisy) measurement model
is is possible to estimate the true theta from the observations y, or will different values of theta give rise to exactly the same dynamics.

attachments.title: ANN MinimallyDisruptiveCurves.jl
attachments.text: Hi all, I thought I would crosspost my package announcement here. The package implements a recent algorithm for regional sensitivity analysis of models with many parameters. Any models, as long as there is a differentiable cost function. The post on the package announcement board is here The user guide, which contains motivation, examples, and jupyter notebooks, is here It relies heavily on the amazing DifferentialEquations.jl ecosystem, so thanks to all who contributed to that!
